valid_articles.Title: Google On Why Soft 404s Are Bad
valid_articles.Description: Gary Illyes from Google explained two reasons why soft 404 errors are bad.  Soft 404s are when a page returns a 200 status okay, but Google thinks that page should return a 404 page not found error.  According to Gary, soft 404s are bad because they (1) limit crawl budget and (2) the pages won't likely show up in Google Search.

valid_articles.Title: Bing Adds Prompt Injection To Bing Webmaster Guidelines
valid_articles.Description: Bing added a new guideline to its Bing Webmaster Guidelines named Prompt Injection.  A prompt injection is a type of cyberattack against large language models (LLMs). Hackers disguise malicious inputs as legitimate prompts, manipulating generative AI systems (GenAI) into leaking sensitive data, spreading misinformation, or worse, according to IBM.

valid_articles.Description: Despite rumors, Reddit is not blocking Google Search from crawling and indexing its content. This article debunks the rumors and confirms that Reddit is not blocking Google.

valid_articles.Description: OpenAI has updated its ChatGPT macOS app to encrypt locally stored conversations after a user discovered that the app was storing chats in plain text.

valid_articles.Title: SEOs: “We’re tired of being outranked by undeserving, inaccurate UGC” Google: “but people love it” Reddit: hold my beer 🍺 👀 Check out their robots.txt:
valid_articles.Description: This tweet suggests that Reddit might be changing its robots.txt to limit Google's crawling, potentially impacting how Reddit content appears in search results.

valid_articles.Title: Nearly 60% of Google searches end without a click in 2024
valid_articles.Description: Meanwhile, almost 30% of clicks go to Google's properties and about 36% of clicks go to the open web, a new zero-click search study finds.

valid_articles.Title: Ask An SEO: What Are The Best Resources To Learn SEO And Who Are The Best People To Follow Online For Good Advice?
valid_articles.Description: Finding reliable SEO resources and experts to follow can be a challenge. Learn how to separate fact from fiction and make informed decisions.
